intro: Hypericum campylopus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved St. John's wort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its upright growth habit and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in late summer, which are typically arranged in clusters. Hypericum campylopus is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is part of the Hypericaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
